cards.name: Tidings
cards.text: Draw four cards.
cards.flavor:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet
cards.originalText: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes another turn after this one.

cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Undo
cards.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

cards.originalText: Return two target creatures to their owner's hand. (You can't play this card unless you can choose two creatures in play.)

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor:
The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up.
—Chinese proverb

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings." —William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wind Sail
cards.text: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.
cards.originalText: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Abyssal Horror
cards.text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror comes into play, target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If that player has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Ancient Craving
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: Knowledge demands sacrifice.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Bog Raiders
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a swamp in play.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a swamp in play.)

cards.name: Chorus of Woe
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Dakmor Ghoul
cards.text: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"
cards.originalText: When Dakmor Ghoul comes into play, target opponent loses 2 life. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Dakmor Lancer
cards.text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.
cards.originalText: When Dakmor Lancer comes into play, destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Dakmor Plague
cards.text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.
cards.originalText: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

cards.name: Dakmor Scorpion
cards.flavor: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

cards.name: Dakmor Sorceress
cards.text: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.originalText: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of swamps you control. (Count only the swamps you have in play, including both tapped and untapped swamps.)

cards.name: Dark Offering
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Dread Reaper comes into play, you lose 5 life.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Grim Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library. You lose 3 life.
cards.flavor:
He who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb
cards.originalText: Search your library for any card and put that card into your hand. You lose 3 life.

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The touch of death is never gentle.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.originalText: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.originalText: Target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If that player has only one card, he or she discards it.)

cards.name: Muck Rats
cards.flavor:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play, target player chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: A hiss before dying.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText: When Serpent Warrior comes into play, you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Shrieking Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player chooses and discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: Evil often dines alone.
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Stream of Acid
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
cards.originalText: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life. (You can't play this card unless you can choose two creatures in play.)

cards.name: Cinder Storm
cards.text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?
cards.originalText: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
cards.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures and all lands. (This includes your creatures and lands.)

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavor: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player. (This includes your creatures and you.)

cards.name: Goblin Cavaliers
cards.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes into play.)

cards.name: Goblin Commando
cards.text: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Commando comes into play, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Goblin General
cards.text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.
cards.originalText: When Goblin General attacks, all Goblins you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
cards.flavor: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

cards.name: Goblin Lore
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.flavor:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."
cards.originalText: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random from your hand.

cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a mountain in play.)

cards.name: Goblin Settler
cards.text: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Settler comes into play, destroy target land.

cards.name: Hulking Goblin
cards.text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
cards.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
cards.originalText: Hulking Goblin can't block.

cards.name: Hulking Ogre
cards.text: Hulking Ogre can't block.
cards.flavor: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.
cards.originalText: Hulking Ogre can't block.

cards.name: Jagged Lightning
cards.text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.
cards.originalText: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature and 3 damage to another target creature. (You can't play this card unless you can choose two creatures in play.)

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.originalText: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn. (You won't lose if you've won before the end of that turn.)

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

cards.name: Ogre Warrior
cards.flavor: Assault and battery included.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes into play.)

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You get another combat phase, followed by another main phase, this turn.

cards.name: Scorching Spear
cards.text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.
cards.originalText: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals to target creature damage equal to the number of mountains you control. (Count only the mountains you have in play, including both tapped and untapped mountains.)

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Thunder Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon comes into play, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Trained Orgg
cards.flavor: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.
cards.originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.
cards.originalText: Flying; haste (This creature may attack the turn it comes into play.)

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.
cards.originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

cards.name: Barbtooth Wurm
cards.flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has an island in play.)

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ." —The Bible, Mark 5:13

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavor: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: Lone Wolf may deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Lynx
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.
cards.originalText: You gain 8 life.

cards.name: Nature's Cloak
cards.text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.originalText: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They're unblockable as long as defending player has a forest in play.)

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Norwood Archers
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"'Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout
cards.originalText: Norwood Archers can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Norwood Ranger
cards.flavor: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

cards.name: Pride of Lions
cards.text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Pride of Lions deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Renewing Touch
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Death just encourages life the more.
cards.originalText: Shuffle any number of creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Silverback Ape
cards.flavor: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

cards.name: Southern Elephant
cards.flavor: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam
cards.originalText: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.originalText: Put up to three land cards from your hand into play.

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
cards.originalText: When Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. Sylvan Basilisk still doesn't deal damage to defending player.)

cards.name: Sylvan Yeti
cards.text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.
cards.originalText: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Thorn Elemental deal its combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Whiptail Wurm
cards.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures with flying. (This includes your creatures.)

cards.name: Wild Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable s long as defending player has a swamp in play.)

cards.name: Willow Elf
cards.flavor: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.
